Joko Anwar Ajak Nobar Perempuan Tanah Jahanam di Bioskop Tua
06 Nov 2019, 10:33 by Tempo.co, Istiqomatul Hayati
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Sutradara Joko Anwar mengajak masyarakat untuk nonton bareng di bioskop tua Grand Senen, Jakarta Pusat. Joko menyatakan bahwa masyarakat yang ingin bergabung dapat mendaftarkan dirinya melalui nomor yang tertera di Instagramnya dan tidak dipungut biaya.
"Nobar Perempuan Tanah Jahanam di bioskop tua Grand Senen. Buruan daftarrr! Gratis !! Buat yang berani ajah! Dihadiri pemain dan kru," tulis Joko pada Selasa, 5 November 2019 di Instagramnya.
Dalam unggahannya tersebut tertera bahwa film akan ditayangkan pukul 19.00 pada Jumat, 8 November 2019. Setiap orang hanya dapat memesan maksimal 2 tiket. Joko juga memperlihatkan kondisi bioskop tua tersebut. Tampak beberapa kursi sudah rusak dan kotor karena sudah lama tidak beroperasi. Joko juga memperlihatkan harga tiket saat bioskop ini masih aktif, sebesar Rp 5 ribu per orang.
Namun, tak disangka ternyata antusias masyarakat sangat tinggi sehingga tiket pukul 19.00 langsung habis. Akibatnya mereka menambahkan jam tayang yaitu pukul 16.00 dan langsung habis hanya dalam waktu 5 menit saja. Karena hal tersebut, Joko menambahkan jam tayang lagi pukul 21.00 namun masyarakat tidak dapat melakukan reservasi melalui admin, melainkan langsung datang ke tempat.
"Nobar Perempuan Tanah Jahanam di bioskop tua Grand, Senen, tadi malem ludes dlm 5 menit. Minta maaf reservasinya belum sempat dibalas ya, teman-teman. Tadi malam yang masuk sampai ribuan wasap. Yang pegang henpon sampai nangis. Jadi, akan kami buka satu show lagi." kata Joko di Instagram @tanahjahanam pada Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Sebelumnya, Joko mengungkapkan keinginannya untuk melakukan nonton bareng (nobar) filmnya, Perempuan Tanah Jahanam di bioskop Atoom Citeureup, Bogor. Namun setelah Marissa Anita dan tim Perempuan Tanah Jahanam melakukan survey dan mendapatkan fakta bahwa debu di dalam bioskop mungkin sudah terkumpul sejak tahun 90an.
"Penampakan, kesurupan massal, bukan penghalang. Tapi kondisi atap yang sewaktu-waktu bisa rubuh tentunya berbahaya. Marissa Anita nonton PTJ sendiri di Bioskop Atoom mewakili. Kami mencari bioskop tua lain," tulis Joko di Instagram pada Jumat, 1 November 2019.

Joko Anwar Invites Nobar Woman to Hell in Old Cinema
06 Nov 2019, 10:33 by Tempo.co, Istiqomatul Hayati
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Director Joko Anwar invites people to watch together in the old cinema of Grand Senen, Central Jakarta. Joko stated that people who want to join can register themselves through the number listed on Instagram and are free of charge.
"Nobar Land Woman Hell in the old cinema Grand Senen. Hurry up! Free! Make the brave! Attended by players and crew," Joko wrote on Tuesday, November 5, 2019 on his Instagram.
In the upload it is stated that the film will be shown at 19:00 on Friday, November 8, 2019. Each person can only order a maximum of 2 tickets. Joko also showed the condition of the old cinema. It appears that some chairs have been damaged and dirty because they have not operated for a long time. Joko also showed the ticket price when the cinema was still active, amounting to Rp 5,000 per person.
However, unexpectedly it turned out that the public's enthusiasm was very high, so the tickets at 7:00 were gone. As a result they add a showtimes which is 4:00 pm and run out in just 5 minutes. Because of this, Joko added that the airtime was again at 21.00 but the public could not make a reservation through the admin, but instead came directly to the place.
"The Woman of the Land of Hell in the old cinema of Grand, Senen, last night finished in 5 minutes. Sorry, the reservation hasn't been returned yet, friends. Last night, there were thousands of smokers. Those who held were responding to tears. So, we will open it. one more show. " said Joko on Instagram @tanahjahanam on Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
Previously, Joko expressed his desire to watch together (nobar) his film, Wanita Tanah Jahanam at the Atoom Citeureup cinema, Bogor. But after Marissa Anita and the Tanah Jahanam Women's team conducted a survey and got the fact that dust in the cinema might have been collected since the 90s.
"The appearance, mass possession, is not a barrier. But the condition of the roof which could collapse at any time is certainly dangerous. Marissa Anita watching PTJ at the Atoom Cinema represents. We are looking for another old cinema," Joko wrote on Instagram on Friday, November 1, 2019.
